block.p: Monique Gladys Farrell, the daughter of Theresa A. Farrell of White Plains and Assemblyman Herman D. Farrell Jr. of New York, was married last Sunday to Malcolm Edwards Guidry, a son of Marjorie M. LaFleur of Lafayette, La., and the late Paul O. Guidry. Msgr. James K. Vaughey officiated at St. Theresa's Church in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y.

Mrs. Guidry, 36, is a freelance marketing director in Lafayette. Her father, a Democrat, is the chairman of the Ways and Means Committee in the New York State Assembly. Her mother is an administrative secretary at the Hebrew Home for the Aged in the Bronx.

Monique Gladys Farrell, the daughter of Theresa A. Farrell of White Plains and Assemblyman Herman D. Farrell Jr. of New York, was married last Sunday to Malcolm Edwards Guidry, a son of Marjorie M. LaFleur of Lafayette, La., and the late Paul O. Guidry. Msgr. James K. Vaughey officiated at St. Theresa's Church in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y.

Mrs. Guidry, 36, is a freelance marketing director in Lafayette. Her father, a Democrat, is the chairman of the Ways and Means Committee in the New York State Assembly. Her mother is an administrative secretary at the Hebrew Home for the Aged in the Bronx.

Mr. Guidry, also 36, served as a staff sergeant in the United States Air Force in Bentwaters, England. He graduated last month from the University of Maryland. His mother retired as a real estate broker in Lafayette. His father owned Guidry Production Services, an oil services company in Lake Charles, La. WEDDINGS
